title: Soulful Japa lecture I Sri Madhu Pandit Dasa I 29.07.2023
speaker: HG Madhu Pandit Dasa

segments.key_quote: Hare Krishna Maha Mantra the necklace of 16 words is the incarnation of the sound incarnation of the Supreme Personality of Godhead Krishna and the Param Prakriti Srimati Radharani
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the Hare Krishna Maha Mantra as the sound incarnation of Krishna and Radharani.

segments.key_quote: Hare Krishna and Rama they are the personalities of infinite love compassion consciousness
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the names Hare Krishna and Rama represent infinite love and compassion, attracting everyone.

segments.key_quote: Krishna himself manifests as the sound.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Krishna's manifestation as sound, possessing infinite consciousness.

segments.key_quote: The sound that we chant is like the vessel into which Nama Prabhu, who is Krishna himself, shines all his satya, chitta and ananda shakti into that sound.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the analogy of sunlight reflecting in water to explain how Krishna's energies manifest in the holy name.

segments.key_quote: For the Lord, there is no difference between his Shakti and himself. There's no difference between Nama Prabhu's effulgence and Nama Prabhu himself.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Krishna descends as Shabda Avatara (sound incarnation) with all His energies, emphasizing the oneness of Krishna and His Shakti.

segments.key_quote: Nama Shakti's, their function is to purify our heart. What is the meaning of purifying the heart? Purifying the heart means the heart is contaminated.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the purification of the heart through Nama Shakti, explaining that the heart is currently contaminated with false perceptions.

segments.key_quote: Asat, we consider as sat, I am the body. And so much of achit, we have forgotten we are eternal, we have eternal relationship with Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the concepts of asat, achit, and nirananda, explaining how we falsely identify with the temporary body and material relationships.

segments.key_quote: All the material sense pleasures, so called material love and intimacy in this world, we think it is true. Only love, intimacy and pleasure in association with Krishna is satya, is truth.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts material pleasures (nirananda) with the true pleasure found in association with Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Therefore the holy name first shines pure satya, chitta and ananda energy.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the soul's essence is satya, chitta, and ananda, and the holy name brings this energy into our hearts.

segments.key_quote: When our heart is cleansed, as I said, Lord is absolute. There is no difference between His reflection and Him.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Chetodharpanam (cleansing of the heart) and how it leads to the manifestation of the pure name on our tongue.

segments.key_quote: Therefore, very effectively if you want, you have to take, you want the effect of nama avatara, you want to experience our original satya, chitta and ananda, then we have to see that the holy name, one after the other, goes into our heart.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of hearing the holy name and following the four regulative principles to experience the full effect of Nama Avatara.

segments.key_quote: So the papa karma means, what is the use of Nama Prabhu, cleaning our heart, cleaning our chitta, of our old pacha, papa beeda, bijas, if, we are creating new bijas, by breaking the four regulative principles.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the four regulative principles are essential to prevent the creation of new sinful seeds (bijas) that hinder the purification process.

segments.key_quote: Of course, the holy name is so powerful, those who are weak in following the four regulative principles, if we hold on to the holy name of the Lord, continue to send the Hare Krishna Maha Mantra in our heart, then our motivation, our pleasure, beliefs, will automatically change, and we will become better and better in following the four regulative principles.
segments.summary: The speaker highlights the mercy of the holy name, stating that even those struggling with the four regulative principles can be purified by consistently chanting.

segments.key_quote: How much advancement we make, how much progress we made, depends upon, how much, how much Sattva, Chitta and Ananda energy, you receive from the Hare Krishna Maha Mantra, and that is, depending upon, how many of your Hare Krishna chanting, you hear and send it into your heart.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that spiritual advancement depends on the amount of Sattva, Chitta, and Ananda energy received from the Hare Krishna Maha Mantra, which is directly related to how attentively we hear the chanting.

segments.key_quote: Thinking activity is the biggest obstacle, for Hare Krishna, you may chant Hare Krishna, but you may not hear, you chant Hare Krishna, and if you are engaged in thinking activity, then you cannot hear.
segments.summary: The speaker identifies thinking activity as the biggest obstacle to hearing the holy name effectively, preventing it from entering the heart.

segments.key_quote: Why think this and that, one day the divine thoughts, will come out of this Nama, with that faith, that this Nama, is a reservoir of all intelligence, is a reservoir of all thoughts.
segments.summary: The speaker encourages faith in the holy name as a reservoir of all intelligence and thoughts, urging listeners to abandon petty thoughts during japa.

segments.key_quote: Now I am speaking to you, your attention is on what I am speaking, everything that I speak, is reaching your heart, but if your mind, and somewhere else about, near home or anything, or you are thinking of something, then what I am speaking, does not reach your heart.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the analogy of a conversation to illustrate how attention and feeling are crucial for the holy name to reach the heart.

segments.key_quote: We have devised a method, by which, we practice soulful japa, where, one mala by mala, we practice chanting, hearing, and one type of feeling.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the concept of soulful japa, emphasizing the importance of chanting and hearing with specific feelings, starting with anusarana bhavana (feeling of obedience to Srila Prabhupada).

segments.key_quote: The first round is always meant, to lock the attention, on chanting and hearing, because always our mind, is in different domains.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that the first round of japa is dedicated to locking the attention on chanting and hearing, acknowledging the difficulty of controlling the mind due to the influence of guna, kala, and karma.

segments.key_quote: If you can only chant here, chant here, chant here, 16 rounds, it is a very big yoga, it's a very big yoga.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the power and importance of chanting and hearing attentively for 16 rounds, highlighting that the strength to do so comes from the mercy of the holy name.

segments.key_quote: I always give example of, an engine starting, in the beginning, with the battery power, the piston is rotated, then the spark plug fires, then the fuel takes over, then the engine fires, then the engine is run, not on your, on the battery power, rather it charges the battery.
segments.summary: The speaker uses the analogy of starting an engine to explain how deliberate hearing and determination initially lock the attention, eventually leading to a self-sustaining connection with the holy name.

segments.key_quote: In the background, there should be a purpose, the first round itself, you should, load the purpose, in your mind, these are all practices, you do for six months, one year, you don't have to, tell your mind, automatically, mind will load, the purpose.
segments.summary: The speaker stresses the importance of having a clear purpose during japa, such as worshipping Krishna and associating with Him, and cultivating shraddha (faith) in the holy name.

segments.key_quote: Krishna says, whatever worship you do, do with prithi, so, bhajatam prithipurvakam, in the Bhagavad Gita, Krishna says.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the concept of Prithi Japa, emphasizing the importance of offering each bead with love and gratitude to Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Hrithpurvaka Japa means heartfully we should chant. We should do from our heart. That means my whole soul should be involved. Soulfully.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces Hrithpurvaka Japa, emphasizing the importance of chanting with the whole soul, heart, mind, and senses, giving everything to the sound incarnation of Krishna.

segments.key_quote: In what mood you should chant and hear. God is before you. How much jubilant you should be. So jubilantly hear. Delightfully chant from your heart and jubilantly hear.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces Aghlada Japa, emphasizing the importance of chanting and hearing with jubilation, and Utsaha Japa, emphasizing the enthusiasm for completing the task of chanting.

segments.key_quote: I have a task to complete, so I enthusiastically chant, one after the other, one after, one more, one more, one more, one more, one more, one more accomplishment, one more offering of loving, love to the Nama Prabhu, in that spirit, that kind of a spirit, that kind of a mind, you give to Nama Prabhu, then Nama Prabhu is very pleased.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of approaching japa as a task to be completed with enthusiasm, and introduces Sambandha Japa, emphasizing that every bead is a relationship, and Saranagati Bhavana, emphasizing total surrender to the Lord.

segments.key_quote: Chant and hear with Kripa Apeksha Bhavana, chant 108 beats, your heart should be craving for Krishna's mercy.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces Kripa Apeksha Bhavana, emphasizing the importance of begging for Krishna's mercy to overcome material attachments and return to Godhead.

segments.key_quote: Feeling that there is no hope. I am hopeless without your mercy.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces Nama Ashraya, emphasizing the importance of seeking shelter in the holy name, and Vinamrita Mala, emphasizing the importance of chanting with humility and dependence on the Lord.

segments.key_quote: Humility is also about how you relate with other children of Krishna. Every living entity is part and parcel of Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker expands on the concept of humility, emphasizing the importance of respectful dealings with all living entities, not just devotees.

segments.key_quote: Always remembering that Krishna is my only maintainer.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces Bhartapatra Japa, emphasizing the importance of remembering that Krishna is the only maintainer, and Raksha Patra, emphasizing that Krishna is the only protector.

segments.key_quote: Gratitude to the Lord for everything. For everything he has given me, everything he has not given me, for everything he has taken away from me, I am eternally grateful to Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces Krita Jnata, emphasizing the importance of expressing gratitude to Krishna for everything, both given and taken away.

segments.key_quote: Begging forgiveness from the Lord, for not treating him with respect, attention, for though he has appeared on my tongue.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces Kshama Apeksha, emphasizing the importance of begging forgiveness from the Lord, and Seva Apeksha, emphasizing the importance of begging for service to Krishna.

segments.key_quote: So this is the essence of soulful Japa. And how much you can perfect, there is no end to it, how much you can perfect.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by summarizing the essence of soulful japa and emphasizing its potential for endless perfection as a relationship with Nama Prabhu.
